titles.title: Tax Relief for Victims of Crimes, Scams, and Disasters Act
Tax Relief for Victims of Crimes, Scams, and Disasters Act

A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to reinstate the deduction for personal casualty losses as in effect prior to the enactment of Public Law 115-97 (commonly referred to as the "Tax Cuts and Jobs Act").

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

bill.summary:
Tax Relief for Victims of Crimes, Scams, and Disasters Act
This bill reinstates the tax deduction for certain personal casualty losses (e.g., resulting from crimes, scams, natural disasters) by eliminating the suspension period (2018-2025) on such deduction.
The bill also extends the period for filing an amended return for claiming personal casualty losses.
